concise_definition: n. 痒, 痒感; v. 发痒, 渴望

definitions.explanation_en: An uncomfortable sensation on the skin that provokes the desire to scratch, often caused by irritation, allergy, or insect bites.
definitions.explanation_cn: 皮肤上引起想抓挠的不适感，通常由刺激、过敏或昆虫叮咬引起。
definitions.example_en: The mosquito bite left a persistent itch that kept her awake all night.
definitions.example_cn: 蚊子叮咬后留下的瘙痒感让她整夜无法入睡。

definitions.explanation_en: A strong, often irresistible desire or craving for something, especially in a figurative sense.
definitions.explanation_cn: 一种强烈、常常难以抑制的渴望，多用于比喻意义。
definitions.example_en: He had an itch to travel after years of working in the same office.
definitions.example_cn: 在同一个办公室工作多年后，他渴望去旅行。

definitions.explanation_en: To cause or experience a tingling, irritating sensation on the skin that makes one want to scratch.
definitions.explanation_cn: 引起或感受到皮肤上的刺痒感，使人想抓挠。
definitions.example_en: The wool sweater itched so badly that she had to take it off.
definitions.example_cn: 羊毛衫痒得厉害，她只好脱下来。

definitions.explanation_en: To have a strong desire or urge to do something, especially when unfulfilled.
definitions.explanation_cn: 有强烈的愿望或冲动去做某事，尤其当这种愿望未被满足时。
definitions.example_en: She itches to start her own business and isn't waiting any longer.
definitions.example_cn: 她渴望自己创业，不再等待了。

comparison.analysis: “Tingle”（刺麻感）指轻微、短暂的刺痛或麻木感，常伴随血液循环或神经刺激，不必然引发抓挠欲望。而 “itch” 强调的是持续的、令人烦躁的痒感，通常会驱动抓挠行为。
“Crave”（渴望）专指对食物、物质或情感的强烈欲望，多用于心理层面，不涉及身体感觉。而 “itch” 作为动词时，虽也可表渴望，但带有更原始、急迫、甚至生理性的冲动意味，常用于口语化表达。
“Scratch”（抓挠）是应对 “itch” 的行为反应，二者是因果关系。前者是动作，后者是感觉。虽然有时可互换使用（如 “I need to scratch” = “I need to relieve an itch”），但 “itch” 是原因，而 “scratch” 是结果。
